name: Legendary Movies Quiz | Classic Movies | 10 Questions

questions.text: 'Casablanca' featured 'Sam' as the piano player. Who played Sam?
questions.explanation:
Dooley Wilson.

	Great job with a great song

questions.text: 'The Graduate' launched Dustin Hoffman, Katharine Ross and Simon and Garfunkel; it was also a directorial victory for this man.
questions.explanation:
Mike Nichols.

	Nichols also did 'Who's Afraid of Virginia Woolf?'

questions.text: '2001: A Space Odyssey' featured Keir Dullea as an astronaut. Who played the other astronaut?
'Ben-Hur' pits Charlton Heston against the Roman, Messala. Who plays him?
questions.explanation:
Stephen Boyd.

	Early epic that has endured.

questions.text: 'The Best Years of Our Lives' dealt with WW II soldiers as they returned from the war. Who starred in the film?
One actor lost the chance of a lifetime - to have a key role in 'The Wizard of Oz' - when he became ill as a result of the makeup that he had to use. Who was this actor?
questions.explanation:
Buddy Ebsen.

	Tough luck - but he rebounded nicely.

questions.text: 'Gone With The Wind' was a rarity: a good book that became a good movie. How did the book's author, Margaret Mitchell, die?
questions.explanation:
Traffic accident.

	She was hit by a cab.

questions.text: The movie, 'From Here to Eternity' was adapted from a novel; the author never again reached that height of popularity.Who was he?
questions.explanation:
James Jones.

	'Some Came Running' and 'Thin Red Line' are also by Jones.

questions.text: 'The Days of Wine and Roses' was Jack Lemmon's first - and probably best - dramatic role. Who was his female co-star?
'Spartacus' was an outstanding effort by all concerned. Who was the director?
